Pan-Seared Chicken with Green Parmesan Mash and Roasted Carrots

Prep: 15 min Cook: 30 min Servings: 2
chicken healthy dinner

Ingredients

For the Green Parmesan Mash

For the Chicken and Pan Sauce

For the Roasted Carrots

Instructions

Prepare the Pan-Fried Carrots

  1. If using fresh carrots, peel and cut into 5cm pieces. If frozen, thaw slightly and pat dry.
  2. Heat olive oil (20ml) in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add carrots and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Cook carrots for 12-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly golden. Sprinkle with chopped parsley (1 tbsp) before serving. Set aside and keep warm.

Make the Green Parmesan Mash

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil.
  2. Add broccoli (200g), cauliflower (150g), spinach (200g), and peas (150g). Cook for 8-10 minutes until very tender.
  3. Drain thoroughly - this is crucial. Press out excess water with a clean kitchen towel if needed.
  4. Transfer to a food processor or use an immersion blender. Add olive oil (30ml), grated Parmesan (40g), salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy. Taste and adjust seasoning. Keep warm in a covered pot.

Cook the Chicken

  1. Season chicken pieces (350g) generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
  2. Heat olive oil (15ml) in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook for 6-8 minutes per side (depending on thickness) until golden brown and cooked through (internal temperature 74°C).
  3. Remove chicken to a warm plate and cover with foil.

Make the Pan Sauce

  1. In the same pan (don't clean it), add minced garlic (1-2 cloves) and cook for 30 seconds.
  2. Pour in white wine (60ml) and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan. Let wine reduce by half (about 2-3 minutes).
  3. Remove from heat and whisk in butter (40g), one piece at a time. Stir in lemon juice (15ml) and chopped parsley (2-3 tbsp). Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Assembly and Serving

  1. Spoon the green Parmesan mash onto each plate. Place chicken alongside the mash. Arrange roasted carrots on the plate.
  2. Drizzle the pan sauce over and around the chicken. Serve immediately.

Notes

Chef's Tips:

  • Make sure to drain the vegetables very well for the mash - excess water will make it watery
  • Don't skip the pan sauce - it ties the whole dish together
  • Let the chicken rest for 2-3 minutes after cooking for juicier results
  • The dish should have beautiful color contrast: golden chicken and carrots, vibrant green mash
  • Pairs wonderfully with a Chilean Chardonnay
